agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that coordinates volunteer services to help with selective, minor home repair projects for households within the county.
service_description: Matches area volunteers with requests for home maintenance and home repair projects. (Roofs are not repaired.) Depending on available volunteers, assistance may be available for yard work, painting, cleaning, snow shoveling, and electrical or plumbing work. A wait list often applies for new requests. Referrals to other resources, such as financial counseling, may be given. Open service area.
taxonomy_name: Home Maintenance and Minor Repair Services
nameLevel4: Home Maintenance and Minor Repair Services
site_details: Call for information; leave voicemail with name, phone, and type of assistance needed.

site_schedule.name: Home Maintenance and Minor Repair Services

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit community-based food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food, laundry soap, dish soap, and toilet paper, to those in need. Deodorant, hand soap, shampoo, and toothpaste may also be available depending on donations. Limited service area.
site_details: First-time clients will need to complete a brief application. -- Existing clients will be given checklist for items needed and drive through to pick up.
site_eligibility: Living in Decatur -- Household income at or below 165% of the Federal Poverty Guidelines -- Limit one visit every 30 days

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency dedicated to supporting families in Adams County during a crisis pregnancy by providing counseling, family planning, and material items for new parents in need.
service_description: Offers free, confidential testing for HIV and two common sexually transmitted diseases/infections (STD/STI) screenings, chlamydia and gonorrhea, by appointment only. Services includes general information such as risk-avoidance education, counseling, and treatment as needed. HIV and sexually transmitted disease/infection (STD/STI) education presentations are available to local area schools and community groups.
site_details: Walk in or call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open
Pregnant women and parents with children under Kindergarten
Women
Pregnant women or parents with children under 3 years

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency dedicated to supporting families in Adams County during a crisis pregnancy by providing counseling, family planning, and material items for new parents in need.
service_description: Provides an incentive program that encourages pregnant women and new parents to access parenting education, health care, and related services. Coupons can be redeemed for maternity and baby supplies (such as diapers cribs, car seats, and mattresses, as well as other baby items).
site_details: Walk in or call to schedule an appointment for registration. Complete an intake form.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and parents with children under Kindergarten
Open
Pregnant women or parents with children under 3 years

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Adams County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Adams County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on property description and ownership.
site_details: Call, visit website, or walk in during business hours for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Adams County

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Adams County.

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Walk in for service during regular business hours. Appointments may be scheduled after-hours.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A primary care medical and dental clinic in Adams County serving people without insurance or a high-deductible insurance.
service_description: Provides a primary care health clinic that specializes in family practice for persons who are uninsured or underinsured. The clinic provides physical and sports exams; medication management; lab work; women's and pediatric care; family planning; wellness care; and treatment of acute and chronic health problems. Sexually transmitted disease (STD) and HIV screenings are also available. Staff will assist with referrals to other medical and social services.
site_details: Walk in; appointments preferred.
site_eligibility: Living in Adams and the surrounding counties -- Uninsured or underinsured individuals or families -- At or below 200% Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for the towns of Geneva and Monroe and rural areas of Adams County.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Adams County
To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older -- Visit www.inmatesales.com to create an account.

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Adams County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment. For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Adams County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child
Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Adams County
Open

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance use issues and their families. Also includes intensive outpatient services and drug screenings.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible patients receiving treatment from this center.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A cooperative of school districts that provides centralized special education services to students living within the boundaries of the participating school districts.
service_description: Provides education support for students with disabilities and special needs. Services range from consultation to resource rooms to self-contained classrooms, depending on the individual needs of the student.
site_details: Call for information about special education services.
site_eligibility: Living in Adams and Wells County public school districts -- Ages 3-22 -- With any form of disability that requires special education services (determined by assessment)

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members
